title: Airports want government to end protectionist stance on international carriers
summary: Airport operators are urging the Indian government to adopt a more liberal approach towards international carriers and move away from protectionist policies in the aviation sector.
content:
Indian airport operators are pushing for liberalization of the country's aviation policies, specifically calling for reduced restrictions on international carriers. The airports argue that the current protectionist stance limits growth potential and connectivity options.

The move comes as airports seek to increase international traffic and optimize their infrastructure usage. They suggest that allowing international carriers more operational freedom would benefit both the aviation sector and travelers through increased competition and better connectivity options.

Current regulations restrict foreign carriers' access to Indian routes and airports, a policy that has long been criticized by industry stakeholders for limiting the country's aviation growth potential.
